prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a triangular prism Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Next, create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 1. Draw a line from point [0, 0] to point [0.75, 0]. 2. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0] to point [0, 0.75]. 3. Draw a line from point [0, 0.75] to point [0, 0]. Close the loop to form a triangle. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by setting the euler angles to [0, 0, 0] and the translation vector to [0, 0, 0.0098]. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a distance of 0.0098 to create a 3D prism shape. The height of this part is 0.0098, the width is 0.75, and the length is also 0.75. Part 2 Construct a set of three cylindrical objects in a triangular pattern Create a new coordinate system at translation vector [0.0666, 0.0666, 0.0098]. Keep the rotation angles at [0, 0, 0]. Create four 2D sketches on four different planes parallel to the X-Y plane, separated by a distance of 0.3062 along the Z-axis. For each sketch: 1. Draw a circle centered at point [0.0081, 0.0081] with a radius of 0.0081. Extrude each sketch by a distance of 0 along the normal direction. Then, cut into the previous solid body by a distance of 0.0488 along the negative Z-axis. The height of this part is 0.0488, the width is 0.3062, and the length is also 0.3062. The final shape, resulting from these two parts, is a three-dimensional, angular, metallic structure with a flat base and a pointed top. Provide the height, width, and length information in the final description.</description>

Create a rectangular hole in the center of the side of the cylindrical object. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.663. 4. Extrude each circle along the Z-axis by varying heights to create a set of cylindrical objects with flat tops and bottoms. 5. Connect the cylindrical objects by creating cylindrical tubes between them. The overall shape should resemble a four-sided pyramid. Note: The above instructions assume the use of a CAD software that supports the creation of cylindrical objects, circles, and extrusions, as well as the ability to specify euler angles, translation vectors, and scaling factors. The final CAD model should match the description and dimensions provided in the JSON data.</description>
